pull.title: qt: Do proper boost::path conversion
pull.body:
Convert from QString unicode from/to the OS-dependent locale as used by boost::filesystem::path as needed.

This should make data directories with special characters in Windows work.

Should solve #3916 and #3905.

Test builds (windows) can be found here:
https://download.visucore.com/bitcoin/bitcoin-2014_03_qt_unicode_path_v3.zip
Signature:
https://download.visucore.com/bitcoin/bitcoin-2014_03_qt_unicode_path_v3.zip.sig

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

issue.title: Windows problem with datadir with unicode chars
issue.body:
When there are characters like é or è in the folder name (with the new -choosedatadir) it complains that the directory doesn't exist.

Probably an unicode conversion issue somewhere (between Qt and Boost?)

See https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=522014.msg5805438#msg5805438

events.body:
Seems the appropriate conversion function don't even exist yet in the boost used by the pulltester.

```
guiutil.cpp:36:58: error: boost/filesystem/detail/utf8_codecvt_facet.hpp: No such file or directory
guiutil.cpp:58: error: â€˜utf8_codecvt_facetâ€™ in namespace â€˜boost::filesystem::detailâ€™ does not name a type
```

Probably needs some boost::filesystem version #ifdefs...

events.message:
qt: Do proper boost::path conversion

Convert from QString unicode from/to the OS-dependent locale
as used by boost::filesystem::path as needed.

Solves #3916.

qt: Only override -datadir if different from the default

Fixes #3905.

events.body:

This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

issue.title: datadir= doesn't function in conf file (Qt GUI)
issue.body:
Could be Windows only.  Had to add -datadir=a:\bitcoin to bitcoin-qt shortcut.

It's specified as:

datadir=a:\bitcoin

in the bitcoin.conf file.

issue.title: utils: Make fs::path::string() always return utf-8 string on Windows
issue.body: Imbue `fs::path` with `std::codecvt_utf8_utf16` at `SetupEnvironment()`, so that default string encoding will be utf-8 inside `fs::path`.
